III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision.
Section (2) An agency shall provide the following minimum supervision:
Description (b) At monthly intervals, ensure that the youth is complying with
the terms of the contract required by R 400.12510, continues to
reside in a safe and acceptable environment, and is managing
expenditures.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff are to ensure youth are residing in a safe acceptable
environment, but youth does not feel safe and there are concerns
these needs are not adequately being met by the agency.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Program Manager was informed of the allegation in person at the
independent living home on 3/8/2023. When informed that Youth
C reported feeling unsafe in the home, she responded that his
behaviors were creating and unsafe environment in the home.
Foster Care Worker 1 (FCW 1) was interviewed at the agency
office 3/8/2023. FCW 1 reported that Youth C has not reported
feeling unsafe in the home to her. She stated she has verified his
safety and the appropriateness of the placement during her
required visits with him. She reported he has created an unsafe
environment due to his behavior, and provided the following
examples:
• Youth C makes racist comments and says things to
antagonize other youths in the home.
• Youth C acts privileged around the other youths and
makes demands of staff.
• Youth C stole the clothing of the other youths in the home.
• Youth C had his girlfriend hiding in the attic of the home
and when she was discovered by a staff member, Youth C
became angry and grabbed that staff member by the
hoodie. When another youth saw this, he hit Youth C,
which started a fight amongst Youth C, Youth C’s girlfriend,
and the other youths in the home.
On 3/10/2023 an email was sent to FCW 1 to inquire about Youth
C’s current placement as it had been updated in his case record to
reflect that he was moved from the independent living home and
case management responsibility had returned to the MDHHS
where Youth C’s case originated. FCW 1 responded stating a 30-
2

day removal notice had been in place due to Youth C’s racist
comments and threats to other youths and the staff of the home.
He was moved on 3/9/2023 after Youth A arrived at the agency
office beating on the windows, cursing, and demanding they open
the door. When asked what he wanted, he refused to answer, so
the police were called. Youth C then left and Program Manager
submitted a request for immediate replacement. FCW 1 does not
know where Youth C was placed by his MDHHS worker.
Foster Care Worker 2 (FCW 2) who is Youth C’s MDHHS worker
was emailed on 3/10/2023 to inquire about Youth C’s current
placement. She responded that Youth C was moved on 3/9/2023,
after hours, to an independent living placement with a friend. She
reported Community Care Organization’s independent living home
is the second independent living home he has been asked to
leave for his aggressive behavior and refusal to participate in
services. She stated he has never told her that he felt unsafe at
the home but did tell her he wanted to be moved back to his home
county. In a follow-up email, FCW 2 reported that Youth C had
previously threatened to file complaints against the independent
living home in which he lived prior to moving to Community Care
Organization.
On 3/17/2023 FCW 2 was interviewed by phone. She stated she
was Youth C’s direct foster care worker prior to his placement in
the Community Care Organization independent living home at
which time they took over case management; however, she
remained as the monitor on the case and maintained contact with
Youth C. Since he left that home, FCW 2 has been reassigned as
his direct worker. She reported Youth C is a challenging youth and
caused a lot of problems while placed at Community Care
Organization’s independent living home. She reported he got
aggressive with one staff causing other youth in home to
intervene. FCW 2 stated that, when Youth C describes that
incident, he states he was almost paralyzed even though he is the
one who pushed another youth down the stairs. FCW 2 reported
Youth C called her on 3/14/2023 to tell her he was in a psychiatric
hospital from 3/12/2022 – 3/14/2023. When she spoke with Youth
C, she asked him to respond to my efforts to reach him, to which
he responded, “I am just going to forget about it.”
Youth C/Complainant was interviewed by phone on 3/17/2023.
He reported the following as concerns that made him feel unsafe:
• There was an incident during which he thought he heard
another youth and a staff fighting upstairs, but he did not
3

see what happened. This allegation was previously
investigated in 2023C0000208.
• There is a staff member who walks in on youths in the
shower. This allegation was previously investigated in
2023C0000210.
• There was an incident after which Youth C was burning
incense in his room and when a staff member came to his
room, they discovered his girlfriend was there, against
house rules. He stated he started calling the staff member
names and told her he would “come for the whole
program.” He stated the staff said he grabbed her by the
hoodie, which he denies. Another youth in the home then
hit Youth C and pushed him into a wall, after which Youth C
threw that youth down the stairs. Youth C’s girlfriend hit
another youth in the home after which Youth C and his
girlfriend left. Youth C reported that, after that incident,
Program Manager was disrespectful to him. Youth C
reported he had a recording of her cussing him out. I
listened to the recording during which Program Manager
was talking to him about having had his girlfriend at the
house, putting his hands on a staff member, and violating
the house rules. She was talking to him about the rules of
the program as well as other programming in which he is
involved.
• On one occasion his girlfriend recorded a conversation she
had with a staff member during which the staff member
referred to Youth C as a “white boy” and talked “trash”
about him. He later sent a copy of the recording and stated
his girlfriend started recording after the staff member called
him “white boy”, so it wasn’t on the recording. The
recording did include Youth C’s girlfriend talking to another
person negatively about her relationship with Youth C. The
discussion sounded as if she and Youth C had an
argument or break up and the other person on the
recording, who Youth C reported was a staff member, was
supporting Youth C’s girlfriend.
• There were some youths “talking shit about him” and an
unidentified staff member just laughed.
• He witnessed a staff member, Staff 1, smoking marijuana
with youth in the independent living home. Youth C did not
remember when this occurred, and he did not report this to
4

anyone. This allegation is being investigated in
2023C0000299.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
• Case Record: Youth C was placed in the independent living
home from 12/9/2022 until 3/9/2023.
• Case Record: Updated Service Plan dated 1/10/2023 was
reviewed and all required face to face contacts in the
youth’s placement were made.
• Case Contacts: Face to face contact was made with the
youth at the home on 12/9, 12/15, 12/21, 1/9, 1/18, 2/8, and
2/13. None of the case contacts documented that the youth
reported feeling unsafe in the home.
• Case contact: A case contact dated 2/24/2023 documented
that Youth C had his girlfriend hiding in the home’s attic.
Once discovered, Youth C and his girlfriend started yelling
and calling other youths names, pushed another youth
down the stairs causing injury, and jumped another youth.
• Text Message: Screenshot of text message provided by
FCW 2 dated 11/2/2022 from Youth C stating “I reported
[previous IL home] to the abuse and neglect hotline so
everyone should look for a backup job. You made my life
extremely hard and keep protecting [name removed] so I’m
taking [previous IL home] off the map.”
Analysis Youth C reported multiple concerns he alleged made him feel
unsafe; however, each of these concerns were previously
investigated, were caused by Youth C’s own actions, or were not
safety related. Youth C’s case managers report that Youth C has
a history of making threats against agencies and never reported
any safety related to concerns to them.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
